summary: A video featuring Bobby, who reacts to scientific and religious interpretations of the properties of Zamzam water, with a focus on the findings of Japanese scientist Masaru Emoto.

events_list.video_caption: The video begins with a display of various dietary supplement products from Grassland Nutrition, including Gold Standard Beef Liver, Carnivore Snack Beef Heart, Bull Kelp Freeze-Dried Crunch, and Energy Formula. Each product is labeled as 100% organic sourced and highlights benefits such as bone and muscle strength, healthier skin and hair, and thyroid support. The products are presented on a reflective surface, with a discount code 'bobby10' displayed at the bottom of the screen. The scene transitions to a colorful test pattern screen, followed by a stylized cityscape at sunset with a car driving down a road. A graphic of a person wearing headphones appears, with the text 'AARRRRRRRRRIGHT GUYS!' displayed prominently. The video concludes with the same graphic and text, emphasizing the energetic and vibrant atmosphere of the scene.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio begins with a male speaker promoting organic freeze-dried organ meats from grass-fed animals, inviting listeners to "save 10%" using a specific code and mentioning a link in the description box. Immediately following this, there is a musical interlude featuring an electronic soundscape, suggesting a slightly eerie or suspenseful mood. Lastly, the clip concludes abruptly with a short static sound.

events_list.video_caption: The video opens with a vibrant, neon-lit cityscape at dusk, featuring a prominent circular logo with headphones and a silhouette of a person's head. Bold, stylized text reads "AAAAAAALLRIGHT GUYS!" in a retro, comic book style, setting a lively tone. The scene transitions to a YouTube search results page, highlighting videos about "Water Reacts to the Quran & Secrets of ZamZam," with the top result showing a hexagonal water crystal structure. A person wearing headphones appears, speaking directly to the camera against a backdrop of water bubbles, with the text "EVEN BY DILUTING THE ZAM ZAM WATER WITH DISTILLED WATER, THE WATER REMAINS THE SAME" displayed at the bottom. The narrative then shifts to a religious ceremony inside a church, where individuals in white robes and head coverings participate in a ritual involving a large golden bowl and lit candles, creating a solemn atmosphere. The video continues with a view of a large cave entrance, where people gather, some in white robes, suggesting a pilgrimage site. The focus then moves to a natural water source flowing from a rocky cave, emphasizing its purity and significance. The scene transitions to a dark background with water splashes forming the Arabic calligraphy of "ZamZam," accompanied by the text "THE BLESSED WATER," reinforcing the sacred nature of the water. The video concludes with the person in headphones reappearing, speaking directly to the camera, maintaining a consistent visual style throughout.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip begins with a man speaking in a conversational tone, welcoming the audience back to the channel. He announces the topic of reaction will be about "water reacts to the Quran and secrets of Zamzam water." The man expresses surprise that Islam has special water. Following the speech, a dramatic music score with low brass plays.

events_list.video_caption: The video begins with a dark background featuring a water splash effect, accompanied by the text "JAPANESE SCIENTIST MASARU EMOTO DISCOVERS THE SECRETS OF ZAMZAM WATER!!!" in bold yellow letters. The logo "merciful SERVANT" is visible in the top left corner. A person wearing headphones and a dark shirt appears in the foreground, gesturing with their hand. The scene transitions to a close-up of a person wearing white gloves adjusting a microscope, with the text "SCIENCE HAS NOW REVEALED NEW SECRETS ABOUT THE WATER OF ZAMZAM" at the bottom. The person continues to adjust the microscope, and the text changes to "AND THE WAY WATER IS INFLUENCED BY THE VIBRATIONS OF THE WORDS AND THOUGHTS OF PEOPLE." The video maintains a scientific and informative atmosphere throughout, focusing on the discovery and study of Zamzam water.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip starts with a male speaker announcing that a Japanese scientist discovered the secrets of Zamzam water. He speaks with a neutral, informative tone, then claims that science revealed new secrets about Zamzam water and how it's influenced by the verses of the Quran, stating that it's been scientifically proven that water is affected by what's recited over it.

events_list.video_caption: The video begins with a close-up of a microscope, accompanied by the text "JAPANESE SCIENTIST MASARU EMOTO FIRST BEGAN EXPERIMENTS IN THE 1960s." A person wearing headphones is visible in the foreground, with the logo "the merciful servant" displayed in the top left corner. The scene transitions to a black-and-white image of a man, with the text "AFTER HE HAD READ THAT EACH SNOWFLAKE FALLING FROM THE SKY IS UNIQUE." The video then shows a child in a snowy landscape, holding a snowball, with the text "AS HIS SCIENTIFIC INSTINCTS TOLD HIM THAT THIS COULD BE TRUE." The narrative continues with a close-up of a snowflake, emphasizing its unique structure, and the text "THE GEOMETRIC SHAPE OF THE SNOWFLAKE IS DETERMINED BY ITS CHEMICAL COMPOSITION." The video then shifts to a laboratory setting, showing a deep freezer and a person working with water droplets, with the text "SO HOW CAN SNOWFLAKES THAT FALL FROM THE SKY BE DIFFERENT FROM ONE ANOTHER?" The final scene depicts a water droplet freezing in mid-air, with the text "THE FREEZING MUST BE SLOW AND THE WATER MUST BE PURE." Throughout the video, the person wearing headphones remains in the foreground, providing a consistent visual element.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip starts with a male speaker introducing Japanese scientist Masaru Emoto and his experiments on water after reading about unique snowflakes. The speaker summarizes Emoto's desire to disprove the theory of snowflake uniqueness due to his scientific instincts, explaining the known chemical composition of water. The speaker quotes Emoto expressing his determination to prove the theory wrong. The speaker then describes Emoto building a lab with a freezer and regulator, emphasizing the importance of slow freezing for atoms to crystallize into a shape created by God.

events_list.video_caption: The video begins with a man wearing headphones and a blue shirt, speaking directly to the camera. The background features a laboratory setting with various scientific equipment, including a flask and test tubes. The text overlay reads, "HE SET UP A DEEP FREEZER WITH A REGULAR CAMERA AND SEVERAL MICROSCOPES EQUIPPED WITH HIGH-RESOLUTION CAMERAS SO HE COULD PHOTOGRAPH THE SNOWFLAKE BEFORE IT MELTED." The scene transitions to a close-up of water splashing, with the text overlay changing to, "HE SAID, 'I TOOK SAMPLES FROM TWO FAUCETS IN MY HOUSE AND PUT THEM IN THE FREEZER.' " The video then shows a dark background with water droplets, accompanied by the text, "THE RESULTS OF THIS EXPERIMENT LED TO HIS EXTENSIVE RESEARCH OF WATER." The man continues to speak, gesturing with his hands. The video then shifts to a beach scene with waves crashing onto the shore, under a cloudy sky, creating a serene and natural atmosphere. The waves are white and frothy, contrasting with the dark sand and the overcast sky. The video concludes with the waves continuing to crash, maintaining the tranquil beach setting.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip begins with a male speaker describing the setup of a deep freezer with a regulator, a cold room, and microscopes. He recounts that he took samples from two faucets, froze them, and each gave him a different snowflake. These samples came from different sources. A second male speaker, with a philosophical tone, responds that this is not surprising, as in nature, nothing is exactly the same. He elaborates that even the same beach has a completely different structure of waves after a few hours, emphasizing that everything in nature differs. A subtle whooshing sound is heard in the background.

events_list.video_caption: The video features a man wearing headphones and a blue shirt, with a beard and a contemplative expression, as he appears to be speaking or presenting. The background transitions from a dark, water-like texture to a lighter, bubble-filled scene, suggesting a shift in the visual theme. Throughout the video, the text "The Merciful Servant" is displayed in the top left corner, while a caption at the bottom reads, "A Muslim later introduced Dr. Emoto to Zamzam water so he could experiment on it," providing context for the subject matter being discussed. The man's hand is visible near his face, indicating a thoughtful or explanatory gesture. The overall atmosphere is one of introspection and exploration, with the visual elements complementing the narrative about Dr. Emoto's experiments with Zamzam water.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip starts with a male speaker stating that a Muslim introduced Dr. Emoto to Zamzam water to experiment on it. The speaker is matter-of-fact.

events_list.video_caption: The video features a man wearing headphones and a blue shirt, who appears to be discussing the Zamzam Well, a holy site in Mecca, Saudi Arabia. The background alternates between images of water bubbles and a Wikipedia page about the Zamzam Well, providing context and information about its significance. The man gestures with his hands, emphasizing his points, and at one point, he holds up a glass of water, likely to demonstrate the purity or unique properties of Zamzam water. The video includes text overlays, such as "EMOTO TOOK A SAMPLE OF ZAMZAM WATER. 'I COULDN'T CRYSTALLIZE IT.'" and "ONE DROP OF ZAMZAM MIXED WITH 1000 DROPS OF PURE WATER," highlighting the water's distinct characteristics. The overall atmosphere is educational, with the man serving as a guide to the viewer, exploring the Zamzam Well's history, significance, and unique qualities.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip starts with a man speaking skeptically about a certain "Zamzam water" and then abruptly stops himself. He has a casual speaking style. After a pause, a man with a slightly higher-pitched voice begins to speak about the water, consulting a Wikipedia page for information. He reads from the page, defining the water as coming from a well in Saudi Arabia that has significance in Islamic narratives. He describes the water's origin story and its importance for millions of pilgrims. He expresses his surprise at learning about holy water in Islam. Then a male speaker describes how Dr. Emoto experimented with Zamzam water, finding it difficult to crystallize, even when diluted. After the man diluted one drop of Zamzam with one thousand drops of distilled water he created a uniquely shaped crystal. The narrator mentions that a scientist stated that the formation of the two crystals was because the word Zamzam is composed of two words, "Zam" and "Zam", ending the clip with a casual "Allah knows best".

events_list.video_caption: The video features a man wearing headphones and a dark blue shirt, who appears to be speaking or presenting. The background alternates between close-up images of snowflakes and a beach scene with waves. The text overlay includes quotes from Masaru Emoto, discussing the impact of playing Quranic verses over water and the resulting crystal formations. The man gestures with his hand, emphasizing his points. The video transitions between different crystal images, highlighting their hexagonal shapes and intricate details. The text mentions the practice of Muslims since the time of Prophet Muhammad, and the word "Bismillah" improving the structure of water. The video concludes with a scene of water being poured from a bottle into a glass, with the ocean in the background, reinforcing the theme of water's purity and structure.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip starts with a male speaker explaining how a Muslim colleague played Quranic verses over water, using a tape recorder, after which crystals formed. He mentions that Dr. Emoto was told Muslims recite "Bismillah" which means "in the name of God" before drinking water. This practice, according to the speaker, improves the quality and structure of water. The speaker expresses an exclamation of gratitude. The tone is informative and appreciative. There is a second male speaker who responds by saying the content is insane and mind blowing. Finally, there is music. The mood is calming and meditative. The tone is quiet, as the clip fades out.

events_list.video_caption: The video features a man wearing headphones and a blue shirt, standing in front of a beach backdrop with waves crashing in the background. He is pouring water from a glass bottle into a clear glass, with the text "The Merciful Servant" displayed at the top of the screen. The man appears to be explaining something, as indicated by his hand gestures and facial expressions. The text at the bottom of the screen reads, "Dr. Emoto completed these experiments, which..." and later changes to "He wrote: 'I have proven that water is capable of fathoming, feeling, and expressing...'" The video transitions to a series of images showing snowflakes with different words written on them, such as "Thank You," "Wisdom," "Truth," "Eternal," "Angel," "I Love You," "Peace," "You Fool," "You Make Me Sick," "Evil," "Polluted Water Before Prayer," and "Polluted Water After Prayer." These images suggest that the man is discussing Dr. Emoto's experiments on the effects of words and emotions on water. The video then returns to the man pouring water, with the text at the bottom of the screen continuing to explain Dr. Emoto's findings. The overall atmosphere of the video is calm and informative, with a focus on the man's explanation and the visual representation of Dr. Emoto's experiments.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip opens with a male speaker describing a Japanese doctor and experimenting with words above water, and his beliefs that words can change the structure of water. The speaker has an enthusiastic tone.  A different male speaker then discusses the doctor's experiments and five-volume book titled "Messages from Water." The second speaker has a more informational tone. The phrase, "The following was written by Dr. Masaru Emoto," follows.

events_list.video_caption: The video features a man wearing headphones and a dark blue shirt, who appears to be speaking throughout the video. The background transitions between various scenes, including close-ups of water splashing, a black surface with water droplets, and a sunset over a desert landscape. The text 'The Merciful Servant' is visible in the top left corner of the screen, indicating the name of the channel or series. The man discusses the quality of water, specifically mentioning 'Zamzam water' and its properties. He explains that regular water increases in quality similarly to Zamzam water, but after recycling, there is no change. The video also touches on the historical context of Zamzam water, mentioning Prophet Ibrahim (peace be upon him) and his wife Hajar's search for water in the desert. The man gestures with his hand, pointing to his chin, as he speaks. The video concludes with a shot of a well, with the text 'The Zamzam Well is located approximately 20 meters (66 feet) below the surface' displayed at the bottom of the screen.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip begins with a male speaker talking in a calm, informative tone about the purity of Zamzam water, stating that its qualities cannot be found elsewhere, and that mixing it with regular water improves the latter's quality. He further explains that even after recycling, Zamzam water remains pure. Addressing possible unfamiliarity, he introduces Zamzam water, which was revealed to Hajar. He summarizes the story of Hajar, who was left in the desert by Prophet Ibrahim and desperately sought water for her infant son, leading to the divine origin of the Zamzam well. He mentions the Kaaba's relation to the well and how Muslims around the globe face the Kaaba in prayer, ending with the Zamzam well being located about 20 meters east of the Kaaba. Following this, a subtle musical element is introduced, giving way to another male speaker in a jovial tone who concludes the video.

events_list.video_caption: The video features a man with a beard and headphones, wearing a dark blue shirt, speaking directly to the camera. He is positioned on the right side of the frame, with a large, hexagonal, translucent object with a circular center displayed prominently on the left. The background is dark, creating a contrast that highlights the man and the object. Text overlays appear at the bottom of the screen, reading "DR EMOTO WAS ALSO TOLD THAT MUSLIMS RECITE (WHICH MEANS, IN THE NAME OF)" in white letters, with a purple banner below stating "Bobby's Perspective" and social media handles for Instagram, YouTube, and Twitter. The man appears to be discussing the topic related to the text, with his facial expressions and gestures indicating engagement with the subject matter. The overall atmosphere is informative, with a focus on the man's commentary and the visual elements presented.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip starts with a male speaker conveying a feeling of perplexity, stating he does "not know exactly why" but the video elicited an undefined sensation. He clarifies he "cannot really define it," describes it as "very strange" and not necessarily emotional, expressing feeling "astonished."

events_list.video_caption: The video begins with a man wearing headphones and a dark shirt, speaking in front of a background featuring a hexagonal shape with a circle in the center. Text overlays the image, reading "DR EMOTO WAS ALSO TOLD THAT MUSLIMS PRAY IN THE NAME OF ALLAH (WHICH MEANS, IN THE NAME OF)" and "Bobby's Perspective" with social media handles for Instagram, YouTube, and Twitter. The scene transitions to a nighttime aerial view of a grand mosque with illuminated minarets and intricate architecture, followed by a close-up of the Kaaba, draped in a black cloth with gold and white Arabic calligraphy. The video then shifts to an aerial view of a cityscape, highlighting a tall building with a clock tower, surrounded by roads and smaller structures, with a hazy atmosphere suggesting either early morning or late afternoon light.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip starts with a single male speaker expressing his wondering about the Kaaba being the center of the world with a miraculous well. He notes that he's curious and wants to go to Mecca to drink from the well and find out more, due to his curious mind when it comes to claims. The speaker conveys a tone of curiosity and desire to investigate these claims.

events_list.video_caption: The video begins with a close-up of a black fabric adorned with intricate gold and white Arabic calligraphy, set against a dark background, creating a solemn and reverent atmosphere. The scene transitions to a person wearing headphones, standing in front of a hexagonal object with a central circle, against a blurred background. Text overlays the image, reading "DR EMOTO WAS ALSO TOLD THAT MUSLIMS RECITE 'BISMILLAHIR RAHMANIR RAHIM' WHICH MEANS, IN THE NAME OF," followed by a call to action to subscribe and follow on social media platforms, with the handle "Bobby's Perspective." The video then shifts to a close-up of red Arabic calligraphy on a white background, displaying the phrase "BISMILLAHIR RAHMANIR RAHIM," which translates to "In the name of God, the Most Gracious, the Most Merciful." The final scene returns to the person in front of the hexagonal object, with the same text overlay, reinforcing the message and encouraging viewers to engage with the content on social media. The video maintains a consistent theme of reverence and cultural significance throughout.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip features a single male speaker, who expresses fascination with the effect of "Bismillah" on water. He mentions his prior knowledge of a professor's work on how water changes shape depending on what is said to it. He believes reciting "Bismillah," which translates to "in the name of God," would cause the greatest transformation in water. He describes this as mind-blowing and mentions learning about holy water in Islam, specifically a well in Mecca.

events_list.video_caption: The video features a man with a beard and headphones, wearing a dark blue shirt, speaking directly to the camera. Behind him, a hexagonal shape with a circle in the center is displayed, resembling a snowflake or a molecular structure. The text overlay reads, "DR EMOTO WAS ALSO TOLD THAT MUSLIMS RECITE 'ALLAHU AKBAR' WHICH MEANS, IN THE NAME OF," indicating a discussion about Dr. Emoto's work and the phrase "Allahu Akbar." The bottom of the screen displays the text "Bobby's Perspective" along with social media handles for Instagram, YouTube, and Twitter, encouraging viewers to follow and subscribe. The background is dark, focusing attention on the speaker and the hexagonal shape. The video transitions to a black screen, suggesting a pause or end of the segment.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip starts with a male speaker wrapping up a video, inviting viewers to comment on the topic of healing power of certain waters, especially for Christians and Muslims, as well as the opinions of atheists. He speaks in a conversational and slightly humorous tone, anticipating possible criticisms about using healing water in hospitals. He encourages viewers to like, subscribe, and support the channel. Afterwards, there's a sudden loud explosion, followed by static.
